title: Historical Stock Price Performance of Arch Resources Inc during Significant Market Events

content.text: On Black Monday, also known as the stock market crash of 1987, the Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA) experienced a significant drop of 22.6%. During this crash, Arch Resources Inc, then known as Arch Coal Inc, witnessed a decline in its stock price. However, the specific impact on the stock price is not available.

The dot-com bubble was a period of excessive speculation in Internet-related companies. In March 2000, the bubble burst, leading to a decline in stock prices across various sectors. Arch Resources Inc, which was primarily focused on coal mining at that time, likely experienced a negative impact on its stock price due to the overall market downturn.

The global financial crisis was triggered by the collapse of Lehman Brothers in September 2008. This crisis resulted in a severe economic downturn and stock market crash. Arch Resources Inc, being a coal mining company, faced challenges during this period due to decreased demand for coal and declining market conditions. The stock price of Arch Resources Inc declined significantly during the crisis.

The COVID-19 pandemic had a significant impact on global stock markets. As governments imposed lockdown measures and businesses faced disruptions, stock markets experienced volatility. Arch Resources Inc, with its operations in the energy sector, was affected by the decline in demand for coal during this period. The stock price of Arch Resources Inc faced substantial declines during the early stages of the pandemic.

news.headline: Arch, Consol to Combine Into $5.2 Billion Coal Giant
news.summary: Arch Resources and Consol Energy have agreed to combine in an all-stock merger of equals to create a new $5.2 billion entity called Core Natural Resources.

news.headline: Consol Energy And Arch Resources To Merge In $5B Domestic Coal Entity
news.summary: Arch Resources (NYSE:ARCH) and Consol Energy (NYSE:CEIX), two of the largest coal miners in the United States, are entering a merger that will create a $5.2 billion coal mining company. "This merger will join two proven leadership teams and best-in-sector operating platforms to establish a premier North American coal producer with worldwide reach and world-class mining and logistics capabilities," said Paul Lang, Arch's CEO. news.headline: Arch Resources and CONSOL Energy to Combine in All-Stock Merger of Equals to Create Core Natural Resources, a Premier North American Natural Resource Company Focused on Global Markets
news.summary: Arch Resources, Inc. ("Arch") (NYSE: ARCH) and CONSOL Energy Inc. ("CONSOL") (NYSE: CEIX) today announced that they have entered into a definitive agreement to combine in an all-stock merger of equals to create Core Natural Resources, a premier North American natural resource company focused on global markets.
